citations.narrative:
The facility did not have complete disposition records. Required information was missing for one Ring-Tailed lemur
temporarily on loan at a different facility. Acquisition and disposition records, including offspring born at the facility,
transported, held, leased, or otherwise disposed of by that dealer or exhibitor are necessary to accurately track animals
being used in regulated activities. The licensee shall make, keep, and maintain records of acquisition/disposition of all
animals that fully and correctly disclose the required information.

Upon inspection, the rabbit housed outdoors was not provided with artificial cooling when the ambient temperature
exceeded 90 degrees Fahrenheit. Though the outdoor enclosure provided shade from direct sunlight and the rabbit
presented comfortably in its enclosure, the kestrel measured temperatures ranging from 96F - 99F at the time of
inspection near this rabbit enclosure.
Rabbits are sensitive to excessive heat. Lack of additional cooling when ambient temperatures are elevated can result in
heat stress, extreme discomfort, or debilitating illness. The licensee shall provide artificial cooling such as a sprinkler
system or other means when temperatures exceed 90 degrees Fahrenheit.
The facility corrected during the inspection.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
